data.event: It was settled around 1909 in what was then the Arizona Territory.
Prospecting and mining in the area first began around 1862, but the remote location and lack of transportation kept activity to a minimum.
By 1904, the railroad was coming to nearby Parker, and local miners Newton Evans and Thomas Jefferson Carrigan saw an opportunity to develop the area.

event.title: a few years, the two miners had built

data.event: Within a few years, the two miners had built a 350-ton furnace, a water pipeline to the Bill Williams River, and hoists for five mine shafts.

event.title: 1908, the claims in the area had been consolidated

data.event: By 1908, the claims in the area had been consolidated by the Clara Gold and Copper Mining Company, which set up its headquarters in the mining camp that would become Swansea.
